intro: Solanoides pubescens, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Solanoides pubescens is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
